reviews.text: I stayed here one night for a business meeting and was very excited to do so. I was greeted warmly by the bell staff and front desk. My room was a 1st floor room overlooking the pool. I was not disappointed at not having an ocean view, since another company was picking up the tab for my room, but I did have a problem with the apparent lack of privacy! My room only had a very flimsy see through curtain. I felt as though I needed to change clothes in the bathroom so the pool patrons did not get an eyeful, and the outdoor security lighting, moon, and morning sun made it nearly impossible to get a quality night's sleep. The bed was very comfortable, however, but I wished for a dark curtain to get that "black out" hotel-room sleep! I'm not sure if my room was just missing a second curtain, but my attempts to find out why were met with perplexed staff, some of whom said that the morning sun waking up guests was part of the design.. O.K....
reviews.title: Nice hotel and service, need better curtains in room
Great Service
reviews.text: Stayed at the Laguna Niguel Ritz Carlton for a convention in March 2005. The service was perfect and the staff was always helpful. I'm not sure what it would have cost to stay here since my company picked up the bill but we had a wonderful time. We rented a car from National Car Rental which is located nearby in Dana Point and drove up and down the coast. A trip to the old mission at San Juan Capistrano is interesting and the town has a lot of quaint shops.

Our family of 5 spent 4 nights at the Ritz arriving on Easter Sunday. We were warmly welcomed by the valet and the front desk staff. We had reserved garden view rooms but were upgraded to ocean view rooms that had just been redone. The rooms were conecting rooms as requested, on the same floor as the lobby which was very convienient.
reviews.title: Our family had a Great Spring break at the Ritz

reviews.text: This is a beautiful property, and while it's luxurious, it doesn't feel overly pretentious - decorated and lit with comfort in mind, and has the feel of a leisure resort.
reviews.title: comfortable, enjoyable

reviews.text: I was upgraded to an oceanview room on the 4th (top) floor - and the view was stunning. I later found out that I was in a room that had not been renovated, as I heard some people discussing the plasma TVs in their room, which my room didn't have (didn't really matter, the view beat anything I could have seen on TV).
reviews.title: great mini get away
New Spa in an old property
reviews.text: While my room wasn't renovated, I didn't feel like it was run-down, and it was very comfortable. This 4th-floor room had vaulted ceilings, which also led to a bright, open, airy feeling - even though the room wasn't huge. There are large wooden plantation shades/doors that slide over the french doors at night, so you won't be woken by the sun in the morning.
The bathroom is all marble, with double sinks and a separate vanity with makeup mirror/light.
reviews.title: Best Place in S. California

reviews.text: Great service - I really found that people went out of their way to help me with various questions I had throughout my stay. I was there for a business conference, and the food served at breakfast, lunch, and dinner was excellent.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, hated the charges.
